meanings.definition: A note or series of notes added at the end of a letter, article, or book as an afterthought or to provide additional information.
meanings.sent1: After finishing her letter, she quickly added a postscript about her upcoming trip.
meanings.sent2: The postscript at the end of the book revealed the fate of the main character.
meanings.sent3: In the postscript, he jokingly mentioned his cat's opinion on the matter.
meanings.sent4: The postscript was like a hidden treasure chest of secrets waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The postscript was a colorful ribbon tying up the story neatly.

meanings.definition: To add a postscript to a letter or other document.
meanings.sent1: She always remembered to postscript her letters with updates on her life.
meanings.sent2: He decided to postscript the email with a thank you note.
meanings.sent3: They would often postscript their messages with funny anecdotes.
meanings.sent4: The way he postscripted his notes showed his attention to detail.
meanings.sent5: To postscript a message is to give it a final touch of personalization.
